subject: Re: [junit] how to run test suite to completion
msgSnippet: ... This is normal JUnit behavior. ... You put whatever setup you need into setUp() and then put each assertion into a separate test.  So you get something
messageBody:
On Mon, 20 Oct 2003, Marc Dugger wrote:

> I'm using JUnit (w/o Ant) to run a sequence of tests. I'm adding all tests
> to a suite and calling run(TestResults) on the suite. However, the test
> only runs until it experiences one failure.

This is normal JUnit behavior.

> How do I specify to run
> completely so I can collect failures from each test? Thanks.

You put whatever setup you need into setUp() and then put each assertion
into a separate test. So you get something like

protected void setUp() { /* gets called before each test */ }
public void testA() {
assertTrue (failureMessage, expectedResult, actualResult);
}
public void testB() { /* assertion B */ }
public void testC() { /* assertion C */ }
// and so forth

After a while, when things are stable, you can collect the various
assertions into one test suite, so you don't have to see so many test
results. In the beginning, fewer tests per suite is better.
